score: 1 out of 2 people found the following review useful
review: Election has all the charm and edge of contemporary high school comedies, but rather than simply flattering teenagers with hip lies about themselves, this extremely well written and imaginative story combines realistic detail with intersecting neurotic fabulations--that of the overambitious, driven teen, and the under-achieving, midlife crisis-inflicted guidance counselor (played brilliantly by Matthew Broderick).
